meanings.sent1: The old rug looked even dreckier after the dog ran through the mud.
meanings.sent2: The alley behind the restaurant was dreckier than the main street.
meanings.sent3: The dreckier the floor, the more excited the toddler was to play in it.
meanings.sent4: Her shoes were so dreckier, they seemed to have their own layer of grime.
meanings.sent5: The dreckier the car, the more it blended in with the abandoned vehicles.

meanings.definition: Of lower quality or value than something else
meanings.sent1: The knockoff bag was dreckier than the designer one.
meanings.sent2: The dreckier option may be cheaper, but it won't last as long.
meanings.sent3: The dreckier toy broke within minutes of being played with.
meanings.sent4: His dreckier ideas were quickly dismissed by the team.
meanings.sent5: The dreckier painting was easily overshadowed by the masterpiece beside it.
